overheat.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to become too hot, or to make something too hot
overheat.translation[0].definitions[0].e: I think the engine’s overheating again.
Try not to overheat the sauce.
overheat.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if a country’s economy overheats, or if something overheats it, it grows too fast and this leads to increases in prices, salaries, interest rates etc
overheat.translation[1].definitions[0].d: if an economy overheats, demand rises too fast, causing prices and imports to rise, a situation that governments may try to correct by raising taxes and interest rates
overheat.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Lifting economies out of recession is easy compared with deciding when to re-apply the brakes so the economy does not overheat later.
Germany overheated its economy as it poured money into rebuilding the East.
